author: Staff Reporter
text:
Members of the Hindu Munnani took out a bike rally to mark the centenary celebrations of Thanulinga Nadar from Nagaraja Temple here on Sunday.

The rally was flagged off by the Union Minister of Road Transport, Highways and Shipping Pon Radhakrishnan in the presence of the Hindu Munnani founder Ramagopalan, State president Arasu Raja and Secretary Bakthavatchalam and other office-bearers.

Thanulinga Nadar was the first State president of the Hindu Munnani. Flagging off the rally, Mr. Pon Radhakrishnan said that everybody should follow the policies and should celebrate his centenary in a grand manner.

The rally concluded at Potraiyadi, where the Manimandapam for the Thanulinga Nadar was declared open by the Hindu Munnani founder Ramagopalan in the presence of Mr. Pon Radhakrishnan, Vellimalai Ashram President Swamy Chathanandaji Maharaj.

Later, inaugurating a religious conference at Mandaicaud, Mr. Radhakrishnan denied the allegations of Tamil Nadu Congress Committee president E.V.K.S. Elangovan that the Union government neglected farmers.

Rs. 2000-crore had been allocated for the State in the union railway budget, out of this Rs. 540 crore was allocated for Kanyakumari district alone. Officials were directed to begin survey for establishing an airport in Kanyakumari district. The Union government had allocated Rs.100 crore for construction of a bridge between Vivekandar Rock and Thiruvalluvar statue in Kanyakumari, he said.

The Union budget to be tabled in Parliament would give top priority for agriculture, Mr. Radhakrishnan said.
title: Bike rally to mark birth centenary
